metadata.title: CVE-2024-36964 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: fs/9p:only translate RWX permissions for plain 9P2000 Garbage in plain 9P2000'sperm bits is allowed through, which causes it to be able to set (amongothers) the suid bit. This was presumably not the intent since the unixextended bits are handled explicitly and conditionally on .u.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
